title: "Nashville" Recap: The Slender Threads That Bind Us Here
text:
"Nashville" Recap: The Slender Threads That Bind Us Here Posted just a moment ago 
ABC/Mark Levine (NASHVILLE) -- Zoey returned to comfort her longtime friend Scarlett O’Connor at her mother’s graveside, in Wednesday’s episode of Nashville . Breaking down while trying to speak at his sister’s service was only the beginning of Deacon Claybourne’s latest struggle, as he faced a strong temptation to return to the bottle. 
Rayna James tried to balance a death in the family while courting her latest attempt to save Highway 65 -- Marcus Keen. The rock star ended up stealing the spotlight from Layla Grant during her Opry debut, further damaging her fraught relationship with Rayna’s label. 
Juliette Barnes turned to drugs to forget, as she continued to run from Avery Barclay and their baby. Tabloid gossip accusing her husband of cheating with her assistant only fueled her descent further. AfterCadence gave him a scare, Avery landed the gig producing Keen’s new project for Rayna, making him believe it’s finally time to let Juliette go. 
Gunnar Scott agreed to help Scarlett’s boyfriend write a song for her, which ironically only magnified the fact that he’s still not over his old flame. 
Look for the next installment of Nashville next Wednesday at 9 p.m. ET on ABC.
